intro: Pilosella cymosa subsp. suprafastigiata, commonly known as the upright pilosella, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It features slender, upright stems with finely hairy surfaces and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. Its botanical structure supports its role in pollination and seed dispersal within its native ecosystems.
